description: Conversion of first floor ancillary offices (to basement/ground floor level bank) to two self contained flats; and external alterations (Resubmission following the withdrawal of planning ref: P/2007/2952-LB dated 23/10/2007)
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.  Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | Samples of the materials to be used for the external surfaces of the development shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority before any part of the development is commenced, and this condition shall apply notwithstanding any indications as to these matters which have been given in this application.  Development shall be carried out in accordance with these approved details.  Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the character and appearance of the existing building with facade value and to safeguard the character and appearance of the Conservation Area, in accordance with policies 4.1, 4.7, 4.8 and 5.5 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | The refuse storage arrangements (including recycling) for both the flats and the bank indicated on drawing 358-200 received on 02 November 2007, shall be implemented prior to first occupation of the development hereby approved and retained thereafter, or as otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  Reason: In the interest of visual appearance of the are and to protect the living conditions of occupiers of neighbouring properties, in accordance with policies 2.10 and 4.1 of the Council's adopted Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004); Supplementary Planning Guidance Note (SPG) 4: 'Refuse and Recycling Facilities'. | A minimum of one cycle stand shall be provided to the west side of the site to provide parking for cyclists in accordance with Council's adopted standards. There should be a 900mm distance between the stands and 550mm between the stand and any obstruction (eg. walls or boundary fencing). Such details shall be implemented and brought into use prior to first occupation of the development hereby permitted, and thereafter retained permanently.  Reason: To provide adequate facilities for cyclists in accordance with policy 9.1, 9.6 and 9.9 of the adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004). | All residential units hereby approved shall be constructed to Lifetime Homes Standards, unless otherwise agreed by the Local Planning Authority. The units approved shall be so constructed prior to first occupation and permanently retained thereafter.  Reason: To ensure adequate access for all, including people with disabilities is provided, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 5.3 of adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) 7 'Accessible Ealing'. | An acoustic report including details of sound attenuation measures from traffic and aircraft noise together with associated ventilation for the proposed residential units shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority. Such details, as approved, shall be implemented prior to the occupation of any of the residential units and thereafter permanently retained.   Reason: In the interest of the occupiers of these residential properties, in accordance with policies 4.1 and 4.11 of adopted Ealing Unitary Development Plan, 'Plan for the Environment' (2004) and Supplementary Planning Guidance (SPG) 10 'Noise and Vibration'.
